definition: pincer attack/attack from two or more sides/converging attack/attack on a flank/fork in chess, with one piece making two attacks
variant of 夾|夹[jia2]
Taiwan pr. used in 夾生|夹生[jia1 sheng1] and 夾竹桃|夹竹桃[jia1 zhu2 tao2]
double-layered/lined (garment)
to press from either side/to place in between/to sandwich/to carry sth under armpit/wedged between/between/to intersperse/to mix/to mingle/clip/folder/Taiwan pr. [jia2]
to hit/to strike/to break/Taiwan pr. [ji2]

sentences.english: Japan also took the opportunity to "go south" on the implementation of China's "attack" strategy.
sentences.chinese: 而日本也借机“南进”对中国实施“夹击”策略。

sentences.english: Os acromiale is a rare predisposing factor of shoulder impingement syndrome.
sentences.chinese: 肩峰小骨是引起肩夹击症候群的罕见原因。

sentences.english: Shoulder impingement syndrome is one of the most common painful shoulder disorders.
sentences.chinese: 肩夹击症候群是一种常见的疼痛性肩关节疾病。

sentences.english: The Chinese film surviving in the hardship is eager to get out of the plight.
sentences.chinese: 内外夹击中艰难生存的中国电影渴盼着走出困境。

sentences.english: It can serve as an inexpensive flanker that's more durable than a Deathjump Spider or a Mephit.
sentences.chinese: 牠可以担任廉价的夹击者，比死跃蜘蛛及魔蝠更耐用。

sentences.english: Between the attack of the past and the attack of the future, the establishment of July struggled.
sentences.chinese: 七月政权在来自过去和来自未来的两面夹击中挣扎。

sentences.english: If not, teams send quick double-team traps to get the ball out of Bryant's hands.
sentences.chinese: 或者他们会用快速夹击来从科比的手上把球断下。

sentences.english: Crushed between two armies, the remaining Dark Iron forces were utterly destroyed.
sentences.chinese: 剩余的黑铁部族部队被两面夹击，全军覆没。

definition: attack from two sides/pincer movement/converging attack/attack on a flank/fork in chess, with one piece making two attacks
to surround/to close in around (one's enemy, prey etc)
to control/to curb/to restrict/to impede/to pin down (enemy troops)
to besiege/to beleaguer/to attack from all sides/to jointly speak or write against sb
to attack violently/to storm
to stop/to obstruct/to bar the way
to check/to stop
to encircle and annihilate/refers to repeated campaigns of the Guomindang against the communists from 1930 onwards
surprise attack
to outflank/to envelop
to pursue and attack
combined assault/to mount a joint attack
to sally/to attack
to face an attack/to repulse the enemy
dominant/controlling/strong/opposite: weak, yielding 弱受/to take by storm (military)
to pull back (an army)/to retreat
